review.title: Load Disaggregation Based on Aided Linear Integer Programming
review.abstract: Load disaggregation based on aided linear integer programming (ALIP) is proposed. We start with a conventional linear integer programming (IP) based disaggregation and enhance it in several ways. The enhancements include additional constraints, correction based on a state diagram, median filtering, and linear programming-based refinement. With the aid of these enhancements, the performance of IP-based disaggregation is significantly improved. The proposed ALIP system relies only on the instantaneous load samples instead of waveform signatures, and hence does not crucially depend on high sampling frequency. Experimental results show that the proposed ALIP system performs better than the conventional IP-based load disaggregation system.

sections.heading: V. CONCLUSION
sections.text: Integer Programming (IP) provides a natural way to solve the problem of load fragmentation by trying to determine which device states are active at a given time. However, earlier IP-based fragmentation of real data encountered problems due to problems associated with temporary measurements and in cases where some states are binary combinations of other states. We proposed a supported linear IP (ALIP) fragmentation approach that overcomes many of the shortcomings of the previous IP-based approach. Experimental results show significant accuracy advantages of ALIP over the previous IP-based fragmentation method, as well as competitiveness over two state-of-the-art machine learning-based fragmentation approaches.
